benchmark_details.name: FinRAGBench-V (A Benchmark for Multimodal RAG with Visual Citation in the Financial Domain)
benchmark_details.overview: FinRAGBench-V is a comprehensive visual RAG benchmark tailored for finance that effectively integrates multimodal data and provides visual citation to ensure traceability. It includes a bilingual retrieval corpus and a high-quality, human-annotated QA dataset spanning heterogeneous data types and question categories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate the development and evaluation of multimodal Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems in the financial domain.

data.source: A retrieval corpus collected from diverse real-world financial document sources, processed to create a QA dataset using LLM assistance and manual verification.
data.size: 60,780 Chinese pages and 51,219 English pages in the retrieval corpus; 1,394 QA pairs in the dataset.
data.format: Various formats including charts, tables, and plaintext.
data.annotation: QA pairs synthesized using GPT-4o assistance with manual verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics such as precision and recall for visual citations are calculated based on the citation sets supporting the generated answers.
methodology.interpretation: High precision and recall indicate effective visual citation capabilities, while ROUGE assesses the accuracy of generated answers compared to ground truth.
methodology.baseline_results: Extensive experiments show multimodal retrievers outperform traditional text-based methods.
methodology.validation: The benchmark's validation relied on both qualitative assessments by experts and quantitative evaluation metrics.
